newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Korea Exchange Bank FRN group forms.
newsitem.headline: Korea Exchange Bank FRN group forms.

text.p: A syndicate group has formed for Korea Exchange Bank's US$200 million subordinated floating rate note issue, joint bookrunner Chase Manhattan Asia said on Tuesday.
Merrill Lynch Far East is the other bookrunner.

The 10-year subordinated notes were launched at par and re-offered at 99.95 on Tuesday morning. They pay a quarterly coupon of 64 basis points over the three-month London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR) for years one through five and LIBOR plus 200 basis points thereafter.
The re-offer yield is LIBOR plus 65 basis points payable quarterly for years one through five and LIBOR plus 132.5 basis points for years one through 10.
ABN AMRO Securities (Far East), ANZ, PaineWebber International, SBC Warburg and Tokyo-Mitsubishi International are co-managers.
The notes are now free to trade.
